means: （离婚或分居后在诉讼期间男方给女方的）赡养费，生活费

sentence.Network_en: His ex - wife has upped the ante in her alimony suit against him.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的 前妻 在诉讼中要求提高赡养费.

sentence.Network_en: A great deal of Jeff's money went in alimony to his three former wives.
sentence.Network_cn: 杰夫的很大一部分钱都用在了向他的前三任妻子支付赡养费。

sentence.Network_en: When his wife was awarded alimony by the court, Snow had to ante up.
sentence.Network_cn: 当他的太太被法庭判定获有离婚赡养费时, 斯诺不得不付这笔钱.

list.abs: We waive to pay any alimony ., 我们免除支付任何赡养费.
you never realize how short a month be until you pay alimony .直至要支付赡养费为止，你决不会了解到一个月多么短促的。
i am no longer paying alimony ., 我已经不在付赡养费了.
period of contribution 供款期permanent alimony 终生赡养费-

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in the sense 'nourishment, means of subsistence'): from Latin alimonia 'nutriment', from alere 'nourish'

entry.tran: （分居或离婚后根据法院指令定期付给对方的）赡养费
entry.def: Alimony is money that a court of law orders someone to pay regularly to their former wife or husband after they have got divorced.

example.ex: A great deal of Jeff's money went in alimony to his three former wives.
example.tran: 杰夫的很大一部分钱都用在了向他的前三任妻子支付赡养费。

means.word_mean: 1. court-ordered support paid by one spouse to another after they are separated
